list.name: Default
list.comment: [+]: try to build the docs via

task.summary:
[!]: don't mix "urldecode()" and "rawurldecode()"
WARNING: urldecode decodes + as spaces while rawurldecode dosn't decode it ...

[!]: don't mix "urldecode()" and "rawurldecode()" v2
WARNING: urldecode decodes + as spaces while rawurldecode dosn't decode it ...
[+]: fix "UTF8:html_encode()" / "UTF8::html_entity_decode()"" [~]: optimize usage of "implode()" [+]: optimize "UTF8::ltrim()" / UTF8::rtrim [+]: add more tests
[+]: try to use installed extensions early, then try an fallback or the polyfill [+]: add more tests
[+]: try to use installed extensions early, then try an fallback or the polyfill v2
[!]: add warnings for missing polyfills v2

[+]: use "UTF8::strtoupper()" for "UTF8::strripos()"
-> fix error with lower-case in word-final position
[+]: try to fix "travis-ci" tests with missing php-extensions
[+]: try to fix "travis-ci" tests with missing php-extensions v2
[+]: try to fix "travis-ci" tests with missing php-extensions v3

[+]: try to improve Travis CI builds
-> http://raphaelstolt.blogspot.de/2016/10/eight-knobs-to-adjust-and-improve-your.html

[*]: try to optimize travis-ci build
-> "phpenv config-add mbstring.ini" dosn't work ?

[*]: try to optimize travis-ci build v2
-> "phpenv config-add mbstring.ini" dosn't work ?

[*]: try to optimize travis-ci build v3
-> "phpenv config-add mbstring.ini" dosn't work ?

[!]: add new default parameter for "UTF8::to_utf8()" / $decodeHtmlEntityToUtf8 [+]: optimize "UTF8::clean()"
-> so this is a breaking change [!], because "to_utf8()" also decoded html-entities in the past (via "UTF8::html_entity_decode()")

[!]: add new parameter for "UTF8::strip_tags()" / "UTF8::parse_str()" -> $cleanUtf8 = false
-> so now you have the ability to clean the input by the parameter or you can use your own implementation
-> I changed the behavior, because of the performance and the api-consistence of the class. All "$cleanUtf8"-parameter are "false" by default and you can use it if needed

[+]: add more "character"-converting methods v2
-> UTF8::hex_to_chr() -> UTF8::decimal_to_chr()

[+]: add more "character"-converting methods v2.1
-> UTF8::hex_to_chr() -> UTF8::decimal_to_chr()

[+]: try to improve Travis CI builds
-> http://raphaelstolt.blogspot.de/2016/10/eight-knobs-to-adjust-and-improve-your.html

[*]: try to optimize travis-ci build
-> "phpenv config-add mbstring.ini" dosn't work ?

-> "phpenv config-add mbstring.ini" dosn't work ?

[*]: try to optimize travis-ci build v3
-> "phpenv config-add mbstring.ini" dosn't work ?

[!]: add new default parameter for "UTF8::to_utf8()" / $decodeHtmlEntityToUtf8 [+]: optimize "UTF8::clean()"
-> so this is a breaking change [!], because "to_utf8()" also decoded html-entities in the past (via "UTF8::html_entity_decode()")

[!]: add new parameter for "UTF8::strip_tags()" / "UTF8::parse_str()" -> $cleanUtf8 = false
-> so now you have the ability to clean the input by the parameter or you can use your own implementation
-> I changed the behavior, because of the performance and the api-consistence of the class. All "$cleanUtf8"-parameter are "false" by default and you can use it if needed

[+]: add more "character"-converting methods v2
-> UTF8::hex_to_chr() -> UTF8::decimal_to_chr()

[+]: add more "character"-converting methods v2.1
-> UTF8::hex_to_chr() -> UTF8::decimal_to_chr()
